column2: Southern Nevada Culinary & Bartenders Pension Plan
column3: UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund (Seattle/WA)
column4: San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders & Service Employees Pension Plan
column5: Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant & Tavern Employees Pension Plan

column2: Automatic on first day contributions are required; or 300 Hours of Service in a Plan Year.
column3: Automatic on first day contributions are required; or 300 Hours of Service in a Plan Year.
column4: Upon working sufficient time to have 3 months of contributions made within a Plan Year.
column5: Earlier of: 1st of month after 5 months of contributions in a Plan Year OR completing 1,000 hours in 12 months.
column6: Upon being credited with 300 Hours of Service in the Plan.

column2:
**5 Years:** If worked ≥1 hour on/after Jan 1, 1997.
**10 Years:** If no work after 1996.
**Participation Rule:** Age 65 + 10th anniversary of participation.
column3:
**5 Years:** If worked ≥1,000 hours per plan year.
**Vesting Service:** 1,000 hours = 1 year; 400–999 hours = partial year.
Note: 2013 Rehab Plan considers <400 hours "inactive."
column4:
**5 Years:** If worked ≥1 hour on/after April 1, 1998 (or 1989 for non-CBA employees).
**10 Years:** If no work after April 1, 1998.
**Oakland Legacy:** Accrues vesting under SF rules post-merger.
column5:
**5 Years:** If worked ≥1 hour on/after June 1, 1999.
**10 Years:** If no work on/after June 1, 1999.
**Participation Rule:** Later of Age 65 and 5th anniversary (post-1988 participation).
column6:
**5 Years:** If worked post-Jan 1, 1996.
**10 Years:** If worked prior to Jan 1, 1996.
**Service Rule:** 1,000 hours = 1 Vesting Year.

column2:
**Age 62:** With 5 years Pension Credit (if worked on/after Jan 1, 1997).
**Age 65:** Under "Participation Rule" (10th anniversary of participation).
column3:
**Age 65:** With 5 years of service.
**Age 65:** With 5th anniversary of participation (if not terminated/on leave).
column4: **Age 65:** With 5 years Vesting Service (post-1998 work) OR 5th anniversary of participation (post-1988 work).
column5:
**Age 65:** With 5 years Vesting Credit (post-1999 work).
**Participation Rule:** Later of Age 65 and 5th anniversary of participation.
column6: **Later of Age 65** or the 5th anniversary of participation (post-1988).

column2:
**Age 55:** With 5 years Pension Credit (if worked on/after Jan 1, 1997).
**Age 55:** With 10 years Pension Credit (if no work after 1993).
column3:
**Age 55:** With 5 years Pension Credit (if worked on/after Jan 1, 1997).
**Age 55:** With 10 years Pension Credit (if no work after 1993).
*Rehab Plan Note:* Active participants retain subsidies; terminated vested participants subject to actuarial equivalence factors.
column4:
**Age 62:** With 10 years Vesting Service.
**Oakland Legacy:** Age 55 with 10 years Vesting Service (for pre-2012 benefits).
column5: **Age 62:** With 10 years Vested Pension Credit (must include 2 years Future Service Credit).
column6:
**Age 55:** With 10 years Past/Future Service (1 must be Future); OR
**Age 55:** With 5 years Vesting Service (if worked on/after June 1, 1996).

column2:
**Retiring 60–62:** 0.75% reduction per month before age 62.
**Retiring 55–60:** Additional 0.50% reduction per month before age 60.
column3:
**Standard:** Reduced by 0.50% per month before age 65.
**Rehab Plan (Default):** Actuarially equivalent (much higher reduction) for inactive participants.
column4:
**Standard:** Reduced by 0.60% per month before age 65.
**Oakland Legacy:** Reduced by 0.50% per month before Normal Retirement Age.
column5: Reduced by 0.50% per month before age 65.
column6: Reduced by 0.50% per month before Normal Retirement Date.

column2:
**Service:** 5 years Pension Credit (must include current/prior year service).
**Condition:** Totally/Permanently disabled + Social Security Award.
**Wait Period:** 5 months.
column3:
**Service:** 10 years service (1 year credited future service).
**Rehab Plan Change:** Eliminated for retirements after age 55; reduced to actuarial equivalent of Age 55 benefit if under 55 (for retirements after May 31, 2013).
column4:
**Service:** 15 years Vesting Service.
**Age:** Must be at least age 55 (unless totally disabled before 55 with 15 years service).
**Condition:** Total Disability (SS Award or Trustee determination).
column5: **None.** (Explicitly states: "This Plan does not provide a Disability Benefit.")
column6:
**Service:** 10 years Past/Future Service OR 5 years Vesting Service (post-1996).
**Hours:** 5,000 lifetime hours + 600 hours in 2 years prior to onset.
**Condition:** Social Security Disability Award required.

column2:
**Flat Dollar Amount:** Based on hours worked/year.
**Example:** 2,000+ hours/year (post-2016) = $37.83/mo per year of service.
**2017 SMM:** 10% increase to all benefits earned post-1975 for active 2016 participants.
column3:
**Percentage of Contributions:**
Pre-2009: 2.5% - 3.3%
June 2009-May 2010: 2.5%
Post-June 2010: 1.0% of contributions.
Rehab Plan (2013) surcharges do not accrue benefits.
column4:
**Complex Tiered/Window System:**
Regular: Based on contribution rate (e.g., $18.80 to $25.00 per credit year).
**Window VII:** $50/year credit (retire 2019–2023).
**Level VI/VII:** Permanent higher rates ($40/$45) for specific employers/timeframes.
**Oakland Legacy:** Vested benefit as of July 1, 2012 + new SF accruals.
column5:
**Mixed Formula:**
Pre-1983: $1.78 x Past Service years.
1985–1988: 5.7% of contributions.
1988–1998: Flat $9.70/year.
1998–2003: 4.55% of contributions.
Post-2003: 2.00% of contributions.
column6:
**Mixed Formula:**
1968–1982: $0.23 per 100 hours.
1983–2007: 3.33% of contributions.
2008–2019: 1.30% of contributions.
Post-May 2019: Variable based on PPA funding % (e.g., 1.60% if >100% funded; 0.50% if <80%).

column2: Life Annuity (No guarantee mentioned in basic definition, but 50% Lump Sum Option available).
column3: Modified Life Annuity (Life + 36-month guarantee). *Rehab Plan* removed 36-month guarantee for new retirements (Life Only).
column6: Life Annuity with 36-Month Guarantee (if death occurs before 36 payments, beneficiary receives balance).

column3: 50% Spouse Option (Pop-up not explicit in 2005 SPD, but 75% option added in 2009).
column4: 50% Qualified Joint & Survivor Annuity (66 2/3% for Oakland Legacy).

column2: 50% Lump Sum Option; Qualified Optional Survivor Annuity; Life Annuity.
column5: 75% Joint & Survivor Annuity; Single Life Annuity.
column6: 75% Qualified Joint & Survivor Annuity; Lump Sum Cash-Out (only if value <$5,000).

column2: **Qualified Pre-Retirement Survivor Annuity:** Lifetime payments to spouse (50% J&S basis).
column3: **50% Spouse Option:** Effective at participant's earliest retirement date.
column4: **Pre-Retirement Survivor Annuity:** 50% of hypothetical J&S benefit. (Oakland Legacy: 66 2/3%).
column5: **Qualified Pre-Retirement Survivor Annuity:** 50% survivor annuity payable when participant would have reached age 62 (or 55 for Oakland legacy).
column6: **Qualified Pre-Retirement Survivor Annuity:** 50% survivor annuity. Spouse may elect to defer until participant would have reached age 62.

column2: **Lump Sum:** Actuarial value of benefits (if vested).
column3: **Lump Sum:** 36 x Monthly Benefit (eliminated by 2013 Rehab Plan).
column4: **None specified** in general summary beyond standard ERISA vested returns (Oakland legacy had 36-month guarantee).
column5: **Lump Sum:** Contributions x $0.07 (1968-1982) + sum of contributions thereafter. Max $5,000.
column6: **Lump Sum:** Contributions x $0.07 (1968-1982) + sum of contributions thereafter. Max $5,000.

column2:
**Age <62:** Suspended if working >40 hours/month in Covered Employment.
**Age 62+:** Not suspended (but no new accruals unless specific election made).
column3:
**Age <62:** Suspended if working >40 hours/month in Industry.
**Age 62–65:** Suspended if >40 hours/month AND >1,000 hours/year.
**Age 65+:** No suspension.
column4:
**Age <65:** Suspended if working in Industry (40 hours rule).
**Age 65+:** Benefits offset actuarially for in-service distributions; 2015/2017 rules allow no offset for certain post-65 work.
column5:
**Age <65:** Suspended if returned to Industry work.
**Age 65+:** No suspension mentioned, allows accrual of additional benefits.
column6:
**Age < Normal Retirement Age (NRA):** Suspended if returned to Covered Employment.
**Age > NRA:** Benefits reduced by actuarial equivalent of payments made; may voluntarily suspend to avoid reduction.

column2:
**Jan 2022:** COVID-19 Assistance. 2020 hours automatically increased to match 2019 hours to prevent breaks in service.
**Feb 2017:** 10% Benefit Increase; Disability exclusions (mental/alcohol) eliminated.
column3:
**Oct 2018:** Admin change to Northwest Administrators.
**Apr 2013:** Rehabilitation Plan. Declared Critical Status. "Preferred" vs "Default" schedules affecting subsidies and accruals.
column4:
**2021:** Special Window VI ($45 benefit, retire by 2026).
**2019/2020:** 4-Year & 6-Year Window VII ($50 benefit rate).
**Covid-19:** Special vesting rules preventing breaks in service during 2020/2021.
column5: **June 2020:** COVID-19 "Outbreak Period" tolling for claims/appeals deadlines. RMD age increased to 72.
column6: **Dec 2020:** SPD Update consolidates amendments including PPA funded percentage accrual rates.

column2:
**Decision:** 90 days (45 for disability).
**Appeal:** 60 days to file (180 for disability).
**Decision on Appeal:** 60 days.
column3:
**Decision:** 90 days.
**Appeal:** 60 days to file.
**Decision on Appeal:** 60 days.
column4:
**Decision:** 90 days (45 for disability).
**Appeal:** 60 days to file (180 for disability).
**Decision on Appeal:** 5 days after meeting.
column5:
**Decision:** 90 days.
**Appeal:** 60 days to file.
**Decision on Appeal:** Next quarterly meeting.
column6:
**Decision:** 90 days.
**Appeal:** 60 days to file.
**Decision on Appeal:** Next quarterly meeting (approx. 60-120 days).

column2: Not explicitly detailed in summary (Standard ERISA court rights apply).
column3: Not explicitly detailed in summary (Standard ERISA court rights apply).
column4: **Civil Action:** Claimant has right to file civil action under Section 502(a) of ERISA.
column5: **Voluntary:** Arbitration is voluntary; no mandatory arbitration clause.
column6: **Mandatory:** Arbitration is the *exclusive* remedy for disputes. Class action waiver included.
